name: Shikimori Bot
description: A Powerful  Telegram group management bot with anime theme.

BOT_TOKEN.description: Your bot token. Get one from @BotFather duh

API_ID.description: Get API_ID from my.telegram.org, used for telethon based modules.

API_HASH.description: Get API_HASH from my.telegram.org, used for telethon based modules.

OWNER_ID.description: Your user ID as an integer.

HEROKU_API_KEY.description: Your Heroku API key, get it from 'https://dashboard.heroku.com/account'

HEROKU_APP_NAME.description: Enter the Heroku app name here (Must an exact same name with your input above).

BOT_USERNAME.description: Username of your bot without the @

BOT_ID.description: to get your bot_id using other bot or userbot

SUPPORT_CHAT.description: Your Telegram support group chat username where your users will go and bother you with shit But be like: MyGroupChatUsernameBlah. If this ever points to masha support than consider you made an enemy.

LOG_CHANNEL.description: Event logs channel to note down important bot level events, recommend to make this public. ex: '-123456'

CASH_API_KEY.description: Required for currency converter. Get yours from https://www.alphavantage.co/support/#api-key

TIME_API_KEY.description: Required for timezone information. Get yours from https://timezonedb.com/api

DATABASE_URL.description: Put sql based database link. Recommended to use Elephant SQL.

FUNC_DB_URL.description: Put sql based database link. Recommended to use Elephant SQL. MUST BE DIFFERENT THAN DATABSE_URL

DEV_USERS.description: ID of users who are Devs of your bot (can use /py, /sh, /eval etc.).

STRICT_GBAN.description: Enforce gbans across new groups as well as old groups. When a gbanned user talks, he will be banned.

DRAGONS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you want to assign as sudo users.

DEMONS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you wanna assign as support users(gban perms only).

TIGERS.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you wanna assign as tiger users.

WOLVES.description: A space separated list of user IDs who you want to assign as whitelisted - can't be banned with your bot.

NO_LOAD.description: Put name of module that you don't want to use or load.

BL_CHATS.description: List of chats you want blacklisted.

DEL_CMDS.description: Set this to True if you want to delete command messages from users who don't have the perms to run that command.

WALL_API.description: Required for wallpaper. Get your's from https://wall.alphacoders.com/ by writting a email to them.

ERROR_LOG_CHANNEL.description: Event logs channel to note down important bot level events, recommend to make this public. ex: '-123456'

REDIS_URL.description: Paste your redis url in format redis://<username of admin role>:<password of admin role>@<endoint url>/<database name>

ANIME_NAME.description: If your bot is based on some anime, type the name of anime. Otherwise, manually edit PM_START_TEXT in main.py

START_MEDIA.description: Paste link of your media(img, video or gif) that you want to show in /start. Otherwise put None.

UPDATE_CHANNEL.description: Leave it as it is, or if you have your own update channel, put channel username without @.

APOD_API_KEY.description: Get yours from https://api.nasa.gov/ to get NASA's picture of the day.

ALIVE_MEDIA.description: Paste link of your media(img, video or gif) that you want to show in /alive. Otherwise put None.

STATS_IMG.description: Paste image link for /stats. Otherwise keep it blank.

NETWORK_USERNAME.description: If you have put a netowrk name, you also have to put its username without @

OWNER_WELCOME_MEDIA.description: URL of media that you want to show when owner of bot joins any chat. Supported file types (jpg, png, gif, webp, mkv, mp4).

INLINE_IMG.description: URL of image for inline querry. Must be a still image.
